result.title: ON Semi: Finally Gaining Recognition It Deserves - Deep-Value Buy Thesis
result.text: The market may finally be waking up to ON's potentially robust AI-related growth prospects, based on the AI revenue growth that doubled YoY every quarter and FY2025 guidance at $250M. The management also reiterates the ambitious FY2027 guidance, aided by the growing design wins in automotive/renewables/data centers and the continued signs of stabilization in automotive/industry. ON trades at FWD P/E of 23.57x and bull-case 2Y PEG of 0.44x, remaining attractive relative to its peer P/E averages of 27x while supporting further upward re-rating potential.

result.title: ASK4SAM: Silberstein & Miklos, P.C. Expands Focus on Semi-Truck Accident Representation in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, Experienced in Handling Injury Claims
result.text: Brooklyn, New York, Dec. 16, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Silberstein & Miklos, P.C., a New York law firm known for its commitment to injury victims throughout the state, is expanding its focus on semi-truck accident cases in the Williamsburg community. With growing concerns about the dangers associated with large commercial vehicles, the firm's dedicated attorneys aim to provide comprehensive representation for individuals harmed in semi-truck accidents, tractor-trailer crashes, and other major roadway collisions. As commercial traffic continues to increase across Brooklyn neighborhoods, the need for experienced litigation support remains critical.

result.title: The Bull Case For ON Semiconductor
result.text: ON Semiconductor (NASDAQ: ON) has transformed itself into a focused power and sensing company centered on silicon carbide, high-voltage power devices, and industrial-grade reliability. Its portfolio is tightly aligned with EV powertrains, industrial automation, energy infrastructure, and datacenter power, areas where efficiency and durability matter far more than commoditized scale.

result.title: onsemi and FORVIA HELLA Extend Strategic Collaboration with Next-Generation Power Technology
result.text: News Highlights: onsemi and FORVIA HELLA signed a new long-term agreement to adopt onsemi's PowerTrench T10 MOSFET technology across advanced automotive platforms. T10 power MOSFETs, manufactured at onsemi's state-of-the-art facility in East Fishkill, NY, deliver significant improvements in efficiency, power density, and system cost.

result.title: On Semiconductor's $6B Capitulation Is Here
result.text: On Semiconductor (ON) is rated Buy, with 25% upside and a $69 price target, supported by operational improvements and a $6B share buyback. Stabilization in automotive and industrial segments, along with recovering inventory and factory utilization, signal a turning point for ON's fundamentals. ON's entry into AI data center power management, including a partnership with Nvidia, adds secular growth potential beyond auto and industrial markets.

result.title: onsemi and Innoscience Announce Plans to Collaborate to Speed Global Rollout of GaN Power Portfolio
result.text: Summary: onsemi announced it has signed a memorandum of understanding with Innoscience to explore expanding production of gallium nitride (GaN) power devices using Innoscience's proven 200mm GaN-on-silicon process. The collaboration would combine onsemi's system integration, drivers, and packaging expertise with Innoscience's GaN wafers and high-volume manufacturing leadership in an effort to bring cost-effective, energy-efficient solutions to market faster and accelerate GaN adoption.

result.text: ON Semiconductor is upgraded to Buy, reflecting solid recent results and signs of recovery after a prolonged automotive downturn. ON's Q3 revenue and earnings surpassed expectations, but guidance remains cautious with limited visibility on a swift margin recovery. AI and datacenter opportunities, including the Vcore Power acquisition, offer potential but are not yet significant growth drivers for ON.

result.title: onsemi Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
result.text: Scottsdale, Ariz, Nov. 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- onsemi (the Company) (Nasdaq: ON) today announced its third quarter 2025 results with the following highlights: Revenue of $1,550.9 million GAAP gross margin of 37.9% and non-GAAP gross margin of 38.0% GAAP operating margin of 17.0% and non-GAAP operating margin of 19.2% GAAP diluted earnings per share and non-GAAP diluted earnings per share of $0.63 Cash from operations of $418.7 million Free cash flow of $372.4 million grew 22% year-over-year to 24% of revenue Year-to-date share repurchases of $925 million, approximately 100% of free cash flow Our third quarter results exceeded expectations, underscoring the strength of our strategy and the resilience of our business model. We're seeing continued signs of stabilization across our core markets, as well as positive growth in AI, said Hassane El-Khoury, President and CEO, onsemi.

result.title: ON Semiconductor: Rich 2027 Targets Imply Potential Capital Appreciation Prospect
result.text: ON offers a deep value Buy opportunity, thanks to the management's rich FY2027 growth guidance, with it implying a potential tripling in capital appreciation. This is attributed to the ongoing portfolio/operational restructuring and the transition to higher-margin/high-growth end markets across automotive and data centers. result.title: Weebit Nanotapes out embedded ReRAM test chips at onsemi production fab
result.text: HOD HASHARON, Israel, Oct. 05, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Weebit Nano Limited (ASX:WBT) (Weebit), a leading developer and licensor of advanced memory technologies for the global semiconductor industry, has successfully taped-out (released to manufacturing) test chips featuring its embedded Resistive Random-Access Memory (ReRAM) module at onsemi's 300mm production fab in East Fishkill, NY. The chips are being developed in onsemi's Treo platform, which is a 65nm Bipolar-CMOS-DMOS (BCD) process.
